background: The ability to estimate both out-migrant abundance and adult returns allows for the calculation of key performance metrics such as smolt-to-adult return rate and recruits-per-spawner. These metrics and indicators can be used to determine population status, evaluate the effectiveness of management actions, and assess recovery of a population.
title: Anadromous Salmonid Population Status and Trend Monitoring
objectives: Provide long-term time series of consistently derived metrics to inform managers on population response to recovery strategies and environmental stressors (i.e., climate change, water diversion, etc.)
Report population status and trends at regular intervals.
Calculate key performance metrics for monitoring the status and trends of an anadromous salmonid population using fish in and fish out data.
